question:
Which of the following statements about the National handloom Development Program are correct?
  1. It provides for 90% of cost bearing by the government.
  2. Arani silk from the south is covered by this scheme.
  3. “Indian handloom” brand was launched in 2015.
  4. Provides assistance through MUDRA scheme.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The NHDP provides for the Hathkargha Samvardhan Sahayata (HSS). This was introduced in 2016. Under this scheme, 90% of loom cost is borne by the government while only 10% is shouldered by the weavers. The scheme operates as a direct benefit transfer (DBT). It seeks to improve the earning by improving quality and productivity in the sector. Statement 2 is correct: Arani silk is one of the recent additions to the program. It is a GI tagged product from Tamil Nadu and is being covered by the Handloom Marketing Assistance Scheme (HMAS). The scheme helps improve the marketing aspect by connecting the producers directly to consumers. It will also assist the setting up of expos for marketing these products. Statement 3 is correct: The concept of “Indian handloom” brand was launched in 2015 to increase the brand value for high quality product. It was launched on National Handloom day, held annually on the 7th of August. It focuses on “zero defect and zero effect on environment”. Statement 4 is correct: The NHDP provides for weaver’s MUDRA scheme. It gives credit to weavers at a concessional interest rate of 6%. Credit guarantee for 3 years is also provided. MUDRA portal was developed in association with PNB for speedy disbursal. MUDRA is Micro Units Development and Refinance Agency.
